titleStmt.title: A treatise of the foure degenerate sonnes viz. the atheist the magician the idolater· and the Iew. VVherein are handled many profitable questions concerning atheisme, witchcraft, idolatry, and Iudaisme: and sundry places of Scripture, cleared out of the originall tongues. Being the fourth volume, of the Workes of Mr. Ioh. Weemse of Lathocker in Scotland, and Prebend of Dunelm.
Works. Vol. 4
titleStmt.author: Weemes, John, 1579?-1636.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Cotes and are to be sold by Iohn Bellamie, dwelling at the three golden Lyons in Corne-hill, neere the Royall Exchange,

notesStmt.note: The words "the atheist the magician" and "the idolater· and the Iew." are enclosed in square brackets on title page.
The last two leaves contain a prayer by Théodore de Bèze and errata.
Identified as part of STC 25209 on UMI microfilm reel 1589.
Reproductions of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.
Appears at reel 1562 and at reel 1589 (same copy filmed twice).

place.placeName: the three golden Lyons in Corne-hill, neere the Royall Exchange
